description: Erection of a single storey extension to the existing office building.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of five years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
Condition : 2 - All new external work shall be carried out in materials that resemble, as closely as possible, in colour and texture those of the existing building, unless otherwise specified in the approved application.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1, EN13 and EN31 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 3 - Full details of cycle storage providing secured storage for not less than 3 cycles within the paved courtyard area shown on approved drawing no. 1556/10 shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The development shall not be occupied or used prior to the implementation of the approved cycle storage, and the cycle storage shall be retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: To ensure satisfactory provision is made for the storage of cycles, in accordance with Policy TR22 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 2000.
Condition : 4 - Full details of a footpath or other form of pedestrian access strip, distinct from the vehicular driveway shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The development shall not be occupied or used prior to the implementation of the approved pedestrian access strip, and the pedestrian access strip shall be retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: To ensure satisfactory provision is made for safe pedestrian access, in accordance with Policy TR21 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 2000.
Condition : 5 - The flat roof of the approved extension shall not be used as a roof terrace or sitting out area.

Reason: To protect the residential amenities of neigthbouring properties, in accordance with Policy EN19 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 2000.
Condition : 6 - The rooflights to be installed in the approved extension shall be made from obscured glass, and retained as such permanently thereafter.

Reason: To preserve the privacy of the occupants of the approved extension and neighbouring residential properties in accordance with Policy EN19 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 2000.
Condition : 7 - A time switch shall be installed prior to occupation to ensure that no light is emitted through the approved rooflights from within the extension, between the hours of 10pm and 7am and shall be permanently retained and maintained in working order.

Reason: To protect the residential amenities of neighbouring premises, in accordance with Policies EN1 and RE2 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 2000.
Condition : 8 - No sound emanating from the use shall be audible within any adjoining premises between 2000 hrs and 0700 hrs.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN5, EN6 and DS6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 9 - Notwithstanding the detail shown on approved drawing 1556/14A a revised arrangement for the roof design adjacent to the boundary of properties fronting fleet road shall be submitted to demonstrate that there is no increase in the height of the existing garden wall and approved by the local planning authority. The development shall not proceed other than in accordance with the approved revised details.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining residential properties in accordance with policies EN1 and EN19 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
